channel.title: Changwon on Every Corner of Korea

item.title: Jinhae-gun Port Town, a planned city created by Japanese imperialism, retains the traces and memories of modern times - Changwon, Gyeongnam, South Korea
item.description:
Jinhae Station

Jinhae-gun Port Town, a planned city created by Japanese imperialism, retains the traces and memories of modern times

Changwon, Gyeongnam, South Korea

In 1926, during the Japanese colonial rule, Jinhae Station (Registered Cultural Festival No. 192) was established. After the Japanese imperialism, which discovered the geographical importance of Jinhae Bay early on, developed Jinhae as a military port city, it was intended to connect the railway between Jinhae Port and the inland. Jinhae Station had a painful time handling Japanese and military supplies. After the independence, it was used as a major route for the logistics required for passengers as well as national defense. Passenger handling was suspended due to lack of demand in 2015, but the history of local history during the Japanese occupation period remains intact and is being managed as a modern cultural heritage. The journey of Jinhae's modern cultural heritage starts at Jinhae Station and tours around Jungwon Rotary, about 500 meters south.
Modern cultural heritage on a radial eight-pronged road
Jungwon Rotary is eight-pronged in the radial direction along the grass square. In 1912, Japanese imperialism was created to make it a military port city and a planned city in Korea on a wide, oily field called 'Jungpyeong Handeul'. In the process, the natives were forced out, and the newly formed city was left entirely Japanese. This is the reason why Japanese-style modern buildings are crowded around Jungwon Rotary.
The travel route is counterclockwise with the 'culture space black and white' as seen from the northwest of Jungwon Rotary. Black and white, as its name suggests, has a sharp contrast between white walls, black window frames, and front door frames. It was a classic music cafe opened in 1952 under the name 'Kalmen'. The Black & White Cafe was loved as a cultural center in Jinhae, where there were no cultural spaces deserved at the time by holding music appreciation and art exhibitions. Currently, it is being used as a civil cultural space by holding regular concerts.
Cultural space black and white view
Jinhae-gun Port Village History Museum is located in the back of the black and white. The two-story Jeoksan house has been remodeled to display modern historical data of Jinhae. Inside, a picture of Jinhae in the 1920s was filled with walls. The city was created in accordance with the interests of Japanese imperialism, but at the time it was a neatly organized modern city.
Jinhae-gun Port Village History Hall 2nd floor
Other exhibitions include Nampo lamps (lamp lamps), hand sewing machines, modern daily necessities, pictures of modern buildings, and fighter models suspended from roof structures. The fighter was an American bomber that dropped an atomic bomb on Hiroshima. In front of Jinhae-gun Port Village History Museum is Marksa Street. Since Jinhae is a city of military port, it is a place where mark companies that put marks and name tags on the soldier's military uniforms are gathered together.
Panoramic view of Maksa Street Park
The three-story building with a red roof on the southwest side of Jungwon Rotary is the Suyang Hall.
Weeping Hall
The roof is pointed, so it is called a 'pointed house' or 'octagonal'. It is actually a hexagonal pavilion. It was said to have been used as a Japanese military guard and fairy during the Japanese occupation.
The roof is pointed, so it is also called a 'pointed house'
Across the street from Suyang Hall, Wonhaeru (formerly Yeonghaeru) is located. It is a Chinese restaurant opened in 1956 by Chul-Hyun Jang, a former Chinese soldier who was a prisoner of UN forces during the Korean War. It is famous for the place where former President Syngman Rhee and former Taiwanese President Chiang Kai-shek ate after the meeting.
Wonhaeru panoramic view
In the 1980s, the current owner took over Younghaeru and changed it to Wonhaeru. Of the two signs on the front of the building, the upper part would be Younghaeru and the lower one would be wanted. The sign of Yeonghaeru is also the first letter of the original letter, which was changed by operating it as Wonhaeru. If you look closely, you can see the difference between the letters next to it.
Old signboard and present signboard are hanging together
Jinhae-gun Port Town Landmark Jinhae Post Office to Viewing Point Jinhae Pagoda
The Jinhae Post Office (Historical Site No. 291) is a Russian-style building that stands out from the Jungwon Rotary. It was said to have been influenced by the Russian consulate in Masan near Jinhae. Columns with entasis (belly shedding) on both sides of the front entrance create an imposing impression.
Jinhae Post Office
The semi-circular roofs and skylights on both sides of the building enhance the overall molding beauty. During the end of the Pacific War, the Japanese colonized the copper plates and copper used in the roofs and railings of the Jinhae Post Office to cover the resources to produce weapons.
Panoramic view of jade
If you go down the street on the left side of the Jinhae Post Office, you will see a multi-purpose building built by the Japanese colonial ruler. It has a long elongated shape and is called 'Jangok (長 屋)'.
The second floor revealing the high-quality aspect of jadeite
It is a form in which six different houses are attached to each other. The first floor is used as a mall, and the second floor is used as a house. Compared to the modern shopping street opposite, it feels like different time zones coexist.
Jangok Street of Cherry Blossom Day
Behind Jangok is the Jinhae Yohangbu Hospital Head Officer (Registered Cultural Property No. 193). It is a Japanese single-story wooden house with a front door protruding in the shape of an 'A'. The value is recognized because it is kept almost circular.
Seonhak Gomtang Main Gate
Currently, it is operated as a restaurant called Seonhak Gomtang.
Representative menu of Seonhak Gomtang Gomtang
Inside the house, there are plenty of things to see, such as a gramophone, wall clock, and old-fashioned ornaments, and the garden is decorated outside.
Seonhak Gomtang Garden where you can appreciate bonsai and chief
In addition to this, it is worth stopping by at the outskirts of Guchungui-dong. It is a Japanese-style tenement house with four houses side by side. During the Japanese colonial period, it was a castle named Cheongru, and maintained its original shape relatively well.
Guchungui-dong
The last stop on the trip to Jinhae-gun Port Village is the Emperor Park, located on the east side of Jungwon Rotary. This is a place where you can overlook the aspect of Jinhae-gun Port Village. You can easily climb the monorail car to the summit of Emperor Mountain.
Monorail Car at Emperor Mountain Park
At the top of the park is a 9-story Jinhae Tower that stands tall against the sky. Originally, there was a Victory Monument built by Japanese imperialism in commemoration of the victory of the Russo-Japanese War. The Jinhae Tower is modeled after the warship mast (a pillar erected perpendicular to the deck on the hull center line).
Jinhae View Point Jinhae Tower
When you climb to the observatory on the 7th floor, the city of Jinhae spreads out around the radial mid-century rotary. The sea is seen far away, reminding that Jinhae is a marine city. You can organize your appreciation of the itinerary by looking at Jinhae city, which is in harmony with the cool natural scenery.
A panoramic view of Jinhae from the Jinhae Tower Observatory
At the Changwon City Jinhae Museum on the 2nd floor, you can view exhibits by theme such as Jinhaesa Temple, Jinhaegun Port Construction, and modern city life.
If you are planning a trip to Jinhae-gun Port Village in the sunny spring, don't miss the cherry blossom season. The town of Cherry Blossoms is a true road, and it is a modern building and is surrounded by Yoshino cherry trees. Enjoying cherry blossom viewing and meeting modern cultural heritage is a one-and-two-trip trip.
Inside Changwon City Jinhae Museum
Travel information

Jinhae-gun Port Village

-Inquiries: Tourism Division, Changwon City 055-225-3691

https://jinhaegunhang.modoo.at/

-Inquiries: Changwon City Tourism Division 055-225-3701

-Inquiries: 055-712-0442

http://www.cwsisul.or.kr/sub_sisul_main.html?code=03_08&Radd=03_08


Restaurants near

-Seonhak Gomtang: Gomtang / 22 Jungwon-ro 32beon-gil, Jinhae-gu, Changwon-si, Gyeongnam / 055-543-6969

-Bangbang: Samgyetang / 3-14 Jinhae-daero 913beon-gil, Jinhae-gu, Changwon-si, Gyeongnam / 055-543-9944

-Jinsang: Daegu Steamed Rice / 8 Chungjang-ro 468beon-gil, Jinhae-gu, Changwon-si, Gyeongnam / 055-547-1678

-Hotel MGV: 78-1 Chungjang-ro, Jinhae-gu, Changwon-si, Gyeongnam / 055-543-3993

-Top Motel: Jungwon Building, 20 Cherry Blossom Road, Jinhae-gu, Changwon-si, Gyeongnam / 055-542-7773

item.title: Nostalgic walking tour of Masan, walking along the mural wall village of Gogopa - Changwon, Gyeongnam, South Korea
item.description:
Masan Gagopa Cobbrang Road Mural Village

Nostalgic walking tour of Masan, walking along the mural wall village of Gogopa

Changwon, Gyeongnam, South Korea

From autumn 2013 to winter, the city of Masan got attention again. It is because of the drama <Response, 1994> that sparked a big topic. The family of Najung, the owner of the boarding house, and the garbage, the main character, were all from Masan. In the drama, Masan was often mentioned, and in the meeting scene that gave a big smile, 'Masan's 3rd Gapbu' sons also appeared. As such, in the background of 1994, Masan City existed proudly. At that time, no one would have thought that Masan City would disappear. Masan was a nationwide city in the 1970s and 1980s and the best city in Gyeongnam. However, in July 2010, it was integrated with Changhae City along with Jinhae City, and now exists as Masan Membership District and Masan Happo District within Changwon City.

The name Masansi has disappeared, but the charm of the space called Masan still remains. The historic town of Masan evokes memories and romance that cannot be felt in a shiny and refined new city. On a warm spring day, let's take a walk from Changdong, the largest bustling street in Masan, past Bulim Market and go to the mural village of Gagopa Koburanggil, which was built in Seongho-dong, Seongho-dong. The rich fragrance that the drama <Response, 1994> delivered gave rises like a haze on a spring day.

Masan Changdong Arts Village
The beginning of the walking tour in Masan was at Changdong Arts Village
Changdong, the center of the old Masan. In <Response, 1994>, there are both Citizen Theater and Koayangdae, which appeared as a symbol of Masan while being the 3rd and 4th Gabbulans in Masan. Is guarded). As such, Changdong was an important place in Masan. However, afterwards, the commercialization of the city led to a decline and the loneliness remained. Fortunately, the Changdong Arts Village project, a downtown regeneration project, began in 2012 and is regaining some vitality.
Changdong Arts Village Alley
From the 1950s to the 80s, Changdong Art Village is a street of culture and art that decorated Changdong, the center of commerce and culture and art, with three themes: Masan Art Trail Alley, Tattoo Art Alley, and Ecole Changdong Alley. Alongside the alleys, there are plenty of cute murals and installation art, and shops and workshops with perfect personality provide time for memories and romance. Don't miss the fun of eating, as the traditional deep-seated restaurants such as Changdong Bokhee House and Changdong Dessert, which were popular during the prosperous season, and Goryeodang and Koayangdae, both mountains of Masan Bakery, are all in this area.
Changdong Arts Village Alley
After the trip to the alley of Changdong Art Village, which continues like a maze, let's move on to Bulim Market, one of Masan's largest commercial districts along with Changdong in the 1980s. Also known as Gyeongnam's representative apparel wholesale market and Tteokbokki alley, Burim Market has also declined since the 1990s. As the number of empty shops increased, a creative crafts village was launched in late 2013 as part of the project to save the original downtown. Various themed workshops such as Korean paper, cloisonne, and ceramics move in to provide attractions and experiences.
Changdong Arts Village Alley
A new and emerging attraction, the mural village in Gogopa Komburgil
Not far from Chang-dong and Burim market, when I heard the story of the new mural village 'Gagopa Cobbrang-gil', I asked the locals, and the person I don't know is a placenta.
Mural village newly established in Sandongne, Seongho-dong
As it is the latest attraction completed in December 2013, it is still unfamiliar to Masan people.
Mural village newly established in Sandongne, Seongho-dong
From Changdong Street, walk past the Burim Market and walk toward the Seonghodong Community Center.
Works of world-class pop artists
Next to it, there is a pretty mural village in Shandongne.
Murals that harmonize with the residents' living base
The total size is 452m in 30 households, so it is not very large. However, the view point of Masan Port is excellent and the sights are full.
Murals that harmonize with the residents' living base
I will also be the first to encounter murals containing local attractions such as Yeonyukgyo Bridge, Tattoo Art Museum, Fish Market, Muhaksan Mountain, Machang Bridge, etc., along with the scenery of the cherry blossom blooming of the old Jinhae in Changwon City.
Murals that harmonize with the residents' living base
The clothesline hanging outside, the flower pots on the street, and the old man-jeong in the neighborhood are harmonized with murals, making it even more friendly.
Murals that harmonize with the residents' living base
Along with the creative murals that melted into the local landscape, works by world-class pop artists such as Andy Warhol's Golden Marilyn Monroe and Roy Lichtenstein's Happy Tears are also fresh.
Wells over 100 years old used by villagers
The mural that wrote <Flower> by poet Kim Chun-soo, who was once active in Masan, and the 100-year-old well created before 1910, used by local residents, also add to the highlights.
Masan city and the sea are visible
No matter where you start on either side of the alley, you can look around and come out.
There are many interesting things to see everywhere.
As you step up, you can enjoy the scenery of the mountain village and murals, and take a step down to enjoy the atmosphere of Masan offshore, city, and murals.
There are many interesting things to see everywhere.
Tattoo Museum overlooking Masan
Mural village is not the end. After walking a little past Shinchusan Apartment, you will see the Tattoo Museum and Masan City Museum. The tattoo museum, where the exterior of the building and the surrounding natural environment catches the eye, is a space where you can experience the world of artwork by the artist and sculptor.
A view of the Tattoo Art Museum right next to Mural Village
He was active in Paris, France, and returned to 1980 to settle in Masan, where he spent his childhood.
A view of the Tattoo Art Museum right next to Mural Village
In 1994, I opened the Tattoo Museum, which I dreamed of, with the intention of building my own art museum. He passed away in 1995 the following year.
A view of the Tattoo Art Museum right next to Mural Village
The museum consists of the 1st Exhibition Hall, the 2nd Exhibition Hall, and the Outdoor Sculpture Exhibition Hall. In 2010, the Tattoo Circular Art Museum was additionally built.
Tattoo artist and sculptor who founded the Tattoo Museum
You can see various works such as sculptures, gypsum circles, oil paintings, etc., inside and outside the museum. In particular, don't miss the view from the terrace of the art museum terrace. Masan Bridge, Machang Bridge, and Chekseom Island unfold at a glance.
Art shop terrace with great views
Travel information

Gagopa Cobbrang Road Mural Village
Address: 15-8 Seonghoseo 7-gil, Masanhappo-gu, Changwon-si, Gyeongnam
Inquiries: 055-220-5704 (Seongho-dong Community Service Center)

Changdong Arts Village
Address: 24, Odongseo 6-gil, Masanhappo-gu, Changwon-si, Gyeongnam
Contact: 055-222-2155

http://www.changdongart.com/

Tattoo Museum
Address: 105, Tattoo Street, Masanhappo-gu, Changwon-si, Gyeongnam
Contact: 055-225-7181

http://moonshin.changwon.go.kr/

1.Nearby Restaurants

Paulownia Donga-gu Grand Sale: Aguijjim / 13, Agujimgil-gil, Masanhappo-gu, Changwon-si / 055-246-3075

Changdong Bokhee House: Food / 21-1 Dongseobuk 14-gil, Masanhappo-gu, Changwon-si / 055-242-1157
Window dynamics: Gimbap‧Udon / 10 Odongseo 6-gil, Masanhappo-gu, Changwon-si / 055-246-1467
6.25 Tteokbokki: Tteokbokki / 16-23 Dongseobuk 12-gil, Masanhappo-gu, Changwon-si / 055-247-4830

2.Accommodation

Rivera Tourist Hotel: 317, Haean-daero, Masanhappo-gu, Changwon-si / 055-248-5200

http://rivierahotelms.co.kr/
